section.name: BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT
section.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000038

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to notification of milk producers under certain circumstances
bill.summary: Authorizes the department of agriculture and markets to notify individual producers of milk in a dairy cooperative of any proposed agreements and orders affecting either the northeast milk marketing area or the western New York milk marketing area; requires notice to occur not less than thirty days prior to the referendum date and include the nature of the proposed amendment.
bill.title: Authorizes the department of agriculture and markets to notify individual producers of milk in a dairy cooperative of any proposed agreements and orders

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000039

bill.summary: Provides that the information collected and maintained by the department of agriculture and markets relating to the registration and identification of premises and animals shall be confidential.
bill.title: Provides that the information collected and maintained by the department of agriculture and markets relating to animals shall be confidential

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000040

bill.summary: Provides that in an agricultural district with a working family farm, any producer, as defined in subdivision three of section two hundred eighty-two of this chapter, shall have the authority to build a home on such family farm property not to supersede existing municipal law.
bill.title: Allows any family member working on a family farm to build a home on such land

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000041

bill.currentCommittee: CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION
bill.lawSection: Parks, Recreation and Historic Preservation Law
bill.summary: Relates to the membership of the Saratoga-Capital district regional park, recreation and historic preservation commission and repeals a section of law relating to the Long Island regional park, recreation and historic preservation commission.
bill.title: Relates to the membership of the Saratoga-Capital district regional park, recreation and historic preservation commission

votes.description: Cultural Affairs, Tourism, Parks and Recreation

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000042

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to extending the enhanced STAR exemption to the disabled surviving spouse of a previously qualifying individual
bill.summary: Relates to allowing a physically disabled surviving spouse who was married to an enhanced STAR qualifying individual to continue to receive the exemption even if the surviving spouse is not sixty-two years of age.
bill.title: Relates to allowing a physically disabled surviving spouse who was married to an enhanced STAR qualifying individual to continue to receive the exemption

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000043

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to the municipal redevelopment law authorizing tax increment bonds payable from and secured by real property taxes levied by a school district within a project area
bill.summary: Authorizes tax increment bonds payable from real property taxes levied by a school district within a blighted project area.
bill.title: Authorizes tax increment bonds payable from real property taxes levied by a school district within a blighted project area

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000044

bill.summary: Provides that owners of private real property exempt from taxation shall give municipalities notice of intention to sell.
bill.title: Provides that owners of private real property exempt from taxation shall give municipalities notice of intention to sell

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000045

bill.summary: Authorizes political subdivisions to award publicly competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in a program designed to foster participation by local businesses in public procurement at a cost premium not to exceed ten percent of the lowest bid.
bill.title: Authorizes political subdivisions to award public competitively bid contracts to businesses that participate in certain programs

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000046

bill.summary: Makes technical corrections to chapter 331 of 2008 which permits municipal corporations to offer health services and insurance for volunteer firefighters and ambulance companies.
bill.title: Relates to provisions of law which permit health services and insurance for volunteer firefighters and ambulance companies through public corporations

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000047

bill.summary: Allows certain not-for-profits to make purchases through use of county contracts.
bill.title: Allows certain not-for-profits to make purchases through use of county contracts

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000048

bill.summary: Makes the director of the state office for the aging a member of the emergency services council.
bill.title: Makes the director of the state office for the aging a member of the emergency services council

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000049

bill.summary: Relates to the defense and indemnification of certain nonjudicial employees certified by the office of court administration and paid by the city of New York to serve as a guardian ad litem in an action or proceeding pending in the housing part of the civil court of the city of New York.
bill.title: Expands the definition of "employee" for the purposes of defense and indemnification of certain nonjudicial employees

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000050

bill.summary: Requires fire chiefs to annually report fire department resource inventory, personnel information and specialized capabilities.
bill.title: Requires fire chiefs to annually report fire department resource inventory, personnel information and specialized capabilities

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000051

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the arts and cultural affairs law, in relation to the composition of the board of directors of the Executive Mansion Trust
bill.summary: Changes the composition of the board of directors of the Executive Mansion Trust.
bill.title: Changes the composition of the board of directors of the Executive Mansion Trust

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000052

bill.currentCommittee: VETERANS, HOMELAND SECURITY AND MILITARY AFFAIRS
bill.summary: Exempts veterans organizations in New York city, as defined in section 452 of the real property tax law, from payment of city sewer and water charges.
bill.title: Exempts veterans organizations in New York city from city sewer and water charges

votes.description: Veterans, Homeland Security and Military Affairs

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000053

bill.summary: An act to amend the real property law, in relation to enacting the "access to justice in lending act"
bill.title: Enacts the "access to justice in lending act"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000054

bill.summary: Requires fair and reasonable disclosure of income, assets and financial obligations of decedent for surviving spouse's waiver of right of election to be enforceable and renders inapplicable the "dead man's statute" for purposes of accepting relevant evidence in this regard and in regard to Totten trust and joint bank account transactions.
bill.title: Requires prior disclosure of income, assets, financial obligations of decedent to enforce surviving spouse's waiver of right of election; waives dead man's statute

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000055

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the domestic relations law, in relation to the use of the proceeds of a retirement plan after the commencement of a matrimonial action
bill.summary: Grants an exemption to provisions prohibiting transfer of any retirement plan upon commencement of a matrimonial action when the retirement plan is already paying benefits.
bill.title: Grants an exemption to provisions prohibiting transfer of any retirement plan upon commencement of matrimonial action when benefits are being paid under such plan

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000056

bill.summary: Requires police accident reports to indicate whether a mobile phone was in use at the time of such vehicle accident.
bill.title: Requires police accident reports to indicate whether a mobile phone was in use at the time of such vehicle accident

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000057

bill.summary: Relates to emergency rule with respect to the removal of vehicles from public streets and highways.
bill.title: Relates to emergency rule with respect to the removal of vehicles from public streets and highways

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000058

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the highway law, in relation to designating a portion of the state highway system in the city of Ogdensburg as the "Trooper Shawn W. Snow Street"
bill.summary: Designates a portion of state highway 812 in Ogdensburg as "Trooper Shawn W. Snow Street".
bill.title: Designating a portion of state highway 812 in Ogdensburg as "Trooper Shawn W. Snow Street"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000059

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to granting small city school districts the authority to provide cafeteria services to students should such district be subject to a contingency budget
bill.summary: Grants small city school districts the authority to provide cafeteria or restaurant services to students should such district be subject to a contingency budget.
bill.title: Grants small city school districts the authority to provide cafeteria services to students should such district be subject to a contingency budget

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000060

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to teachers' rights
bill.summary: Relates to teachers' rights; adds other specified personnel to teachers and teaching assistants where the board of cooperative educational services takes over a program.
bill.title: Relates to teachers' rights

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000061

bill.summary: Includes Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority and its police officers and aircraft rescue firefighters in the provisions of the civil service law providing for the resolution of impasses in collective bargaining negotiations by the public employment relations board.
bill.title: Includes Niagara Frontier transportation authority and its police officers and aircraft rescue firefighters under provisions for resolution of impasse in collective bargaining negotiations

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000062

bill.summary: Provides for binding arbitration in negotiations with all members who are designated as security services or security supervisors.
bill.title: Relates to binding arbitration in negotiations with members who are designated as security services or security supervisors

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000063

bill.summary: Authorizes the board of elections to employ election inspectors to work half-day shifts with adjusted compensation; county boards of election shall prescribe the necessary rule and procedures to ensure proper poll site operation.
bill.title: Authorizes the board of elections to employ election inspectors to work half-day shifts with adjusted compensation

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000064

bill.summary: Provides that a person may not alter his or her caller identification with the intent to defraud, harass or harm the recipient of the call.
bill.title: Provides that a person may not alter his or her caller identification with the intent to defraud, harass, mislead or harm a third party or the recipient of the call

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000065

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to absentee ballots
bill.summary: Simplifies the absentee ballot process to make it easier to vote in such manner by removing requirement for certain information on circumstances for the voter's absence.
bill.title: Simplifies the absentee ballot process by removing requirement of certain information that is to be provided

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF FIRST REPORT-0000000066

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to requests for affidavit ballots including application for registration and enrollment
bill.summary: Provides that an affidavit ballot submitted on election day at a polling place shall also constitute an application to register to vote.
bill.title: Provides that an affidavit ballot shall also constitute an application to register to vote

section.name: BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT
section.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT-0000000035

bill.summary: Authorizes insurance premium reductions for non-commercial private passenger vehicles equipped with retrofitted daytime running lamps; requires commissioner to promulgate by rule, qualifications and standards for the installation of such lamps.
bill.title: Authorizes insurance premium reductions for non-commercial private passenger vehicles retrofitted with daytime running lamps

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT-0000000036

bill.summary: Requires the New York state health foundation and the state insurance fund to file annual audited financial statements with the office of the state comptroller. Requires the New York state health foundation and the state insurance fund to file annual audited financial statements with the office of the state comptroller.
bill.title: Requires the NYS health foundation and state insurance fund to file annual audited financial statements with the office of the state comptroller

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON ORDER OF SECOND REPORT-0000000037

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to approval of certain insurance and annuity policy forms
bill.summary: Provides that an approved policy form that has been revised may continue to be delivered or issued for delivery in NYS without further approval from the superintendent.
bill.title: Provides that an approved policy form that has been revised may continue to be delivered or issued for delivery in New York state without further approval

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000001

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to designation of a "Senior Citizens' Day" as a day of commemoration
bill.summary: Designates the first Tuesday in June to be known as a day of commemoration as "Senior Citizens' Day".
bill.title: Designates the first Tuesday in June as "Senior Citizens' Day"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000002

bill.summary: Designates as a day of commemoration, February 14th, to be known as "Congenital Heart Defects Awareness Day".
bill.title: Designates as a day of commemoration, February 14th, to be known as "Congenital Heart Defects Awareness Day"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000003

bill.summary: Designates August seventh as "Family Day", a day of commemoration.
bill.title: Designates August seventh as Family Day, a day of commemoration

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000005

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to designating June 2 as Italian Independence Day, a day of commemoration
bill.summary: Establishes June second as Italian Independence Day, a day of commemoration.
bill.title: Establishes June second as Italian Independence Day, a day of commemoration

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000006

bill.summary: Increases the fees notary publics are entitled to from two to five dollars.
bill.title: Increases the fees notary publics are entitled to from two to five dollars

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000007

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to designating August 20th as a day of commemoration to be known as "Staten Island Day"
bill.summary: Designates August 20th as a day of commemoration to be known as "Staten Island Day".
bill.title: Designates August 20th as a day of commemoration to be known as "Staten Island Day"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000008

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to the designation of a "Thurgood Marshall Day" as a day of commemoration
bill.summary: Designates May seventeenth as "Thurgood Marshall Day", a day of commemoration.
bill.title: Designates May seventeenth as "Thurgood Marshall Day"

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000009

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to requiring certain information to be provided to the legislature prior to appropriating money to state entities for certain projects
bill.summary: Requires certain information to be provided to the legislature prior to appropriating money to state entities for economic development projects.
bill.title: Requires certain information to be provided to the legislature prior to appropriating money to state entities for economic development projects

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000010

bill.summary: Establishes a new day of commemoration to be known as Women's Equality day, on August 26th.
bill.title: Establishes a new day of commemoration to be known as Women's Equality Day

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000013

bill.summary: Permits the court to grant post-conviction motions to vacate a judgment when the issue raised upon such motion is ineffective assistance of counsel in certain cases in which the court would otherwise be required to deny the motion.
bill.title: Permits the court to grant post-conviction motions to vacate a judgment when the issue raised upon such motion is ineffective assistance of counsel

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000015

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend chapter 549 of the laws of 1994, amending the public authorities law relating to the membership composition of the metropolitan transportation authority board, in relation to extending the effectiveness of such provisions
bill.summary: Relates to the membership composition of the metropolitan transportation authority and the establishment of specific committees to assist the chairman of such authority.
bill.title: Relates to the membership composition of the metropolitan transportation authority board

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000019

bill.summary: Designates the month of May as elder appreciation month.
bill.title: Designates the month of May as elder appreciation month

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000020

bill.summary: Requires licensed and certified residential real property appraisers to report mortgage underwriting appraisals of one to four family residential properties in the city of Buffalo to the office of real property services.
bill.title: Requires licensed and certified residential real property appraisers to report appraisals in the city of Buffalo to the office of real property services

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000021

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to authorizing defendants to make electronic appearances in pending criminal actions
bill.summary: Authorizes defendants to make electronic appearances in pending criminal actions.
bill.title: Authorizes defendants to make electronic appearances in pending criminal actions

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000022

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the general business law and the social services law, in relation to irrevocable trust accounts for funeral and burial expenses
bill.summary: Authorizes the creation of irrevocable trust accounts for funeral and burial expenses.
bill.title: Authorizes the creation of irrevocable trust accounts for funeral and burial expenses

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000023

bill.summary: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village.
bill.title: Authorizes county highway superintendents to rent road machinery from any city, town or village

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000024

bill.summary: Adds interior design as a type of contract that can be entered into by the state.
bill.title: Adds interior design services as a type of contract that can be entered into and negotiated by the state

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000025

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the public officers law, in relation to certain activities by members of a board of a community college
bill.summary: Relates to certain activities by members of a board of a community college.
bill.title: Relates to certain activities by members of a board of a community college

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000026

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to including Lake Ronkonkoma within the definition of "inland waterways" for the purposes of waterfront revitalization
bill.summary: Includes Lake Ronkonkoma within the definition of "inland waterways" for the purpose of waterfront revitalization.
bill.title: Includes Lake Ronkonkoma within the definition of inland waterways for the purposes of waterfront revitalization

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000027

bill.summary: Establishes the New York state greenhouse gases management research and development program to promote new technologies and processes which shall avoid, abate, mitigate, capture or sequester carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases.
bill.title: Establishes the New York state greenhouse gases management research and development program

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000028

bill.title: Requires a reduction in sulfur emissions for all heating oil used in non-attainment areas

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000029

bill.summary: Prevents individuals from being denied standing in private actions alleging violations of the environmental quality review provisions of the environmental conservation law solely on the basis that the injury alleged by such individual does not differ in kind or degree from the injury that would be suffered by the public at large.
bill.title: Relates to standing to bring an action for a violation of the provisions of the state environmental quality review act

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000030

bill.summary: Declares a policy of equal treatment of people of all races, cultures, religions, incomes, education levels and sexual preference in the development and enforcement of environmental laws, regulations and policies.
bill.title: Declares a policy of equal treatment in development and enforcement of environmental laws, regulations and policies

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000031

bill.summary: Authorizes the electronic filing of freshwater wetlands regulatory maps.
bill.title: Relates to the electronic filing of wetlands regulatory maps

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000032

bill.summary: Removes the provision requiring a candidate's residence to be published prior to an election.
bill.title: Removes the provision requiring a candidate's residence to be published prior to an election

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000033

bill.actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to making applications for absentee ballots
bill.title: Relates to applications for absentee ballots

calNo.id: cal-floor-00006-2009-supp--sect-BILLS ON THIRD READING-0000000034

bill.summary: Establishes a replacement tire energy efficiency consumer information program for passenger cars and light-duty trucks; requires the department to establish rules and regulations for replacement tire fuel efficiency ratings standards; expires upon the enactment of substantially similar federal legislation.
bill.title: Establishes a replacement tire energy efficiency program for passenger cars and light-duty trucks
